item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee
Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

summary.text:
Amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish the office of the Under Secretary of Homeland Security for Emergency Preparedness and Response.

Requires the President to select as Under Secretary an individual with broad background, professional knowledge, and substantial experience in emergency training, planning, and preparedness, including work experience relating to emergency preparedness, at least four years of which must be experience in management of emergency personnel or assets.

bill.title: Under Secretary for Emergency Preparedness and Qualifications Act of 2005

item.title: Under Secretary for Emergency Preparedness and Qualifications Act of 2005
A bill to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish certain qualifications for the office of the Under Secretary for Emergency Preparedness and Response.
Under Secretary for Emergency Preparedness and Qualifications Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
